title: Rosario Dawson's gushes over Cory Booker debate performance in campaign email
text:
Rosario Dawson is taking to the campaign trail for her beau Cory Booker, offering donors a chance to win a trip to the Atlanta debate in November with her.

The actress and activist said that she wanted to let the public know how 'proud' she was of the Senator's performance during the Democratic Presidential Candidate debate in Ohio on Tuesday.

'Cory is kind, thoughtful, brilliant and thinks of everyone else before he thinks of himself,' Dawson claimed in her message. 'That’s why I love him, and that’s also why I think he’d make an amazing president.'

Rosario Dawson said in a campaign email that she wanted to let the public know how 'proud' she was of the Senator Cory Booker's performance during Tuesday debate

Dawson and the Booker team are offering one donor and a friend a trip to Atlanta for the November debates. The winner would get to enjoy a meal with the couple the next day

The 40-year-old actress said that Booker's performance 'filled me with joy and hope for our country's future.'

She continued: 'It’s a feeling I’ll never forget, and one I’d love to invite you to experience with me.'

Dawson and the Booker team are offering one donor and a friend a trip to Atlanta for the November debates.

The winner would get to enjoy a meal with the couple the next day.

The 40-year-old actress said that Booker's performance 'filled me with joy and hope for our country's future'

Any sized donation can get a person entered to win the opportunity.

Booker's campaign will cover the costs of the flight, hotel and the tab for food.

Booker and Dawson smiled for cameras as they arrived together at Otterbein University in Westerville on Tuesday evening

'Throughout the last nine months, it’s been beautiful to see the possibilities of our country through Cory’s eyes,' Dawson said in the letter.

'I’m so excited that these debates are giving millions of Americans a chance to get to know the man I love.'

Booker and Dawson smiled for cameras as they arrived together at Otterbein University in Westerville on Tuesday evening.

There was a seat reserved for the actress in the second row of the debate hall prior to it getting underway.

She was seated between Booker's New Hampshire director and Doug Emhoff, who is the husband of fellow candidate Sen. Kamala Harris.

Dawson was noticeably absent from the first three debates in June, July and September.
